thread.title: Billerica Man Wins Second $1M Scratch Ticket Prize
thread.title_full: Billerica Man Wins Second $1M Scratch Ticket Prize

author: CBS Boston
title: Billerica Man Wins Second $1M Scratch Ticket Prize
text:
Billerica Man Wins Second $1M Scratch Ticket Prize February 6, 2017 8:57 PM Filed Under: Massachusetts Lottery Alan Danehy (Photo credit MA State Lottery) 
BOSTON (CBS) – For the second time in less than two and a half years, a Billerica man won a $1 million prize on a scratch ticket from the Massachusetts State Lottery. 
Alan Danehy won his latest prize in the “$2,500,000 Holiday Magic” $10 instant game. In October 2014, he won $1 million in the “100X The Cash” $10 instant game. 
As he did with the first prize, Danehy chose to receive his winnings in a one-time $650,000 payment. He plans to use some of his latest winnings to buy a car. 
Danehy bought both winning tickets at Bell Food Mart on Boston Road in Billerica. The store will once again receive a $10,000 bonus for its sale of the ticket.
